component.name: dapr
component.title: Dapr
component.description: Dapr component which interfaces with Dapr Building Blocks.
component.label: cloud,saas

configKeys.label: common
configKeys.description: List of keys for configuration operation

configStore.label: common
configStore.description: The name of the Dapr configuration store to interact with, defined in statestore.yaml config

contentType.label: common
contentType.description: The contentType for the Pub/Sub component to use.

pubSubName.label: common
pubSubName.description: The name of the Dapr Pub/Sub component to use. This identifies which underlying messaging system Dapr will interact with for publishing or subscribing to events.

topic.label: common
topic.description: The name of the topic to subscribe to. The topic must exist in the Pub/Sub component configured under the given pubsubName.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions (if possible) occurred while the Camel consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. Important: This is only possible if the 3rd party component allows Camel to be alerted if an exception was thrown. Some components handle this internally only, and therefore bridgeErrorHandler is not possible. In other situations we may improve the Camel component to hook into the 3rd party component and make this possible for future releases. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

previewClient.label: consumer
previewClient.description: The client to consume messages by the consumer

bindingName.label: producer
bindingName.description: The name of the Dapr binding to invoke

bindingOperation.label: producer
bindingOperation.description: The operation to perform on the binding

concurrency.label: producer
concurrency.description: Concurrency mode to use with state operations

consistency.label: producer
consistency.description: Consistency level to use with state operations

eTag.label: producer
eTag.description: The eTag for optimistic concurrency during state save or delete operations

httpExtension.label: producer
httpExtension.description: HTTP method to use when invoking the service. Accepts verbs like GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc. Creates a minimal HttpExtension with no headers or query params. Takes precedence over verb

key.label: producer
key.description: The key used to identify the state/secret object within the specified state/secret store

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

methodToInvoke.label: producer
methodToInvoke.description: The name of the method or route to invoke on the target service

secretStore.label: producer
secretStore.description: The name of the Dapr secret store to interact with, defined in local-secret-store.yaml config

serviceToInvoke.label: producer
serviceToInvoke.description: Target service to invoke. Can be a Dapr App ID, a named HTTPEndpoint, or a FQDN/public URL

stateOperation.label: producer
stateOperation.description: The state operation to perform on the state store. Required for DaprOperation.state operation

stateStore.label: producer
stateStore.description: The name of the Dapr state store to interact with, defined in statestore.yaml config

verb.label: producer
verb.description: The HTTP verb to use for invoking the method

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

CamelDaprServiceToInvoke.label: producer
CamelDaprServiceToInvoke.description: Target service to invoke. Can be a Dapr App ID, a named HTTPEndpoint, or a FQDN/public URL

CamelDaprMethodToInvoke.label: producer
CamelDaprMethodToInvoke.description: The name of the method or route to invoke on the target service

CamelDaprVerb.label: producer
CamelDaprVerb.description: The HTTP verb to use for service invocation

CamelDaprQueryParameters.label: producer
CamelDaprQueryParameters.description: The query parameters for HTTP requests

CamelDaprHttpExtension.label: producer
CamelDaprHttpExtension.description: The HttpExtension object for service invocation. Takes precedence over verb

CamelDaprStateOperation.label: producer
CamelDaprStateOperation.description: The state operation to perform on the state store. Required for DaprOperation.state operation

CamelDaprStateStore.label: producer
CamelDaprStateStore.description: The name of the Dapr state store to interact with, defined in statestore.yaml config

CamelDaprSecretStore.label: producer
CamelDaprSecretStore.description: The name of the Dapr secret store to interact with, defined in local-secret-store.yaml config

CamelDaprConfigStore.label: producer
CamelDaprConfigStore.description: The name of the Dapr config store to interact with, defined in statestore.yaml config

CamelDaprKey.label: producer
CamelDaprKey.description: The key used to identify the state/secret object within the specified state/secret store

CamelDaprETag.label: producer
CamelDaprETag.description: The eTag for optimistic concurrency during state save or delete operations

CamelDaprConcurrency.label: producer
CamelDaprConcurrency.description: Concurrency mode to use with state operations

CamelDaprConsistency.label: producer
CamelDaprConsistency.description: Consistency level to use with state operations

CamelDaprMetadata.label: producer
CamelDaprMetadata.description: Additional key-value pairs to be passed to the state store

CamelDaprStates.label: producer
CamelDaprStates.description: List of states for bulk save operation

CamelDaprKeys.label: producer
CamelDaprKeys.description: List of keys for bulk get operation

CamelDaprTransactions.label: producer
CamelDaprTransactions.description: List of transactions for execute transactions state operations

CamelDaprPubSubName.label: common
CamelDaprPubSubName.description: The name of the Dapr Pub/Sub component to use. This identifies which underlying messaging system Dapr will interact with for publishing or subscribing to events.

CamelDaprTopic.label: common
CamelDaprTopic.description: The name of the topic to subscribe to. The topic must exist in the Pub/Sub component configured under the given pubsubName.

CamelDaprContentType.label: common
CamelDaprContentType.description: The content type for the Pub/Sub component to use

CamelDaprID.label: consumer
CamelDaprID.description: Gets the unique identifier for the event, used to distinguish it from other events

CamelDaprSource.label: consumer
CamelDaprSource.description: Gets the origin of the event, typically a URI indicating the component or service that generated the event

CamelDaprType.label: consumer
CamelDaprType.description: Gets the string indicating the type of cloud event

CamelDaprSpecificVersion.label: consumer
CamelDaprSpecificVersion.description: Gets the version of the CloudEvents specification that the event conforms to

CamelDaprDataContentType.label: consumer
CamelDaprDataContentType.description: Gets the content type of the event data

CamelDaprBinaryData.label: consumer
CamelDaprBinaryData.description: Gets the raw binary data payload of the event, if present (for events where data_base64 is used instead of data)

CamelDaprTime.label: consumer
CamelDaprTime.description: Gets the timestamp of when the event occurred

CamelDaprTraceParent.label: consumer
CamelDaprTraceParent.description: Gets tracing info for following the event across services (includes trace ID and span ID)

CamelDaprBindingName.label: producer
CamelDaprBindingName.description: The name of the Dapr binding to invoke

CamelDaprBindingOperation.label: producer
CamelDaprBindingOperation.description: The operation to perform on the binding

CamelDaprConfigKeys.label: producer
CamelDaprConfigKeys.description: List of keys for configuration operation

CamelDaprSubscriptionId.label: consumer
CamelDaprSubscriptionId.description: The id for configuration change subscription

operation.label: producer
operation.description: The Dapr building block operation to perform with this component

configKeys.label: common
configKeys.description: List of keys for configuration operation

configStore.label: common
configStore.description: The name of the Dapr configuration store to interact with, defined in statestore.yaml config

contentType.label: common
contentType.description: The contentType for the Pub/Sub component to use.

pubSubName.label: common
pubSubName.description: The name of the Dapr Pub/Sub component to use. This identifies which underlying messaging system Dapr will interact with for publishing or subscribing to events.

topic.label: common
topic.description: The name of the topic to subscribe to. The topic must exist in the Pub/Sub component configured under the given pubsubName.

previewClient.label: consumer
previewClient.description: The client to consume messages by the consumer

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions (if possible) occurred while the Camel consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. Important: This is only possible if the 3rd party component allows Camel to be alerted if an exception was thrown. Some components handle this internally only, and therefore bridgeErrorHandler is not possible. In other situations we may improve the Camel component to hook into the 3rd party component and make this possible for future releases. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

bindingName.description: The name of the Dapr binding to invoke

bindingOperation.label: producer
bindingOperation.description: The operation to perform on the binding

stateStore.description: The name of the Dapr state store to interact with, defined in statestore.yaml config
